title: Tianjin Quanjian reveal they apologised to agent Jorge Mendes after pulling out of Radamel Falcao deal
text:
Sport Tianjin Quanjian reveal they apologised to agent Jorge Mendes after pulling out of Radamel Falcao deal The Chinese side have been desperately seeking a striker and discussed Diego Costa, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, Wayne Rooney and the Colombian Share Mendes' client Falcao has impressed in France this season (Photo: Getty Images/PA) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Big-spending Chinese side Tianjin Quanjian have revealed that they apologised to Jorge Mendes after pulling out of a deal to sign Monaco striker Radamel Falcao. 
The newly-promoted side are under the guidance of Fabio Cannavaro, and have added Axel Witsel and Alexandre Pato to their squad ahead of their debut in the Chinese Super League. 
Owner Shu Yuhui, backed by the Quanjian Group, has been trawling the globe for a marquee name to play alongside Pato in attack. 
That led to him meeting with agent Mendes in Dafeng in January, to discuss potential signings. Jorge Mendes handing over a signed Ronaldo shirt to Shu Yuhui (Photo: Twitter: @CSLfutbol) Read More 
One of those was Diego Costa, the Chelsea striker who topped their list. However, despite an £80million transfer fee and £570,000-a-week wages being mooted, he remained at Stamford Bridge. 
Edinson Cavani, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and Wayne Rooney have all also come under consideration. 
However a move for Rooney was vetoed by Cannavaro with the Italian questioning whether he was the right fit, declaring: "he simply doesn’t suit our style of play." 
Now Shu has revealed that the Chinese side were close to landing Falcao, who is experiencing a renaissance at Monaco this season, having scored 23 goals in 29 games for the French side. 
Nonetheless, after Cannavaro again stepped in, the Chinese side pulled out - leaving Shu to apologise to Mendes, as they seek to keep their relationship with football's most powerful agent onside. Monaco striker Radamel Falcao has 23 goals to his name this term (Photo: Getty) United striker Rooney was also targeted (Photo: REUTERS) Cannavaro vetoed moves for both Rooney and Falcao (Photo: Robert Cianflone) 
"Not long ago, Jorge Mendes came to the city of Dafeng to meet us. We had an overnight negotiation and Radamel Falcao was about to sign the contract to join us. 
"However, the deal was scuppered by Cannavaro who later told us he doesn't suit our style of play. Price and reputation are not our only concerns. 
"We had to apologise to Mendes." 
The Chinese transfer window closes at the end of February, ahead of the 2017 CSL season, which kicks off on Friday. 
When the summer transfer window opens, Tianjin are expected to move once again for a new centre-forward, and Shu is bullish about what the summer holds for his side now that they are in China's top tier. Mendes list of clients is certainly eye-catching (Photo: PA) Chelsea hitman Costa remains the Chinese side's first choice (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) 
"We made an attempt for Pato last year but he was not willing to come because our club was still in second division then. After we get promoted, he came. 
"We also approached Diego Costa and other stars. It remains to be seen who will join us in June but I can assure you that the new players will be on the same level as Costa. 
"Theoretically speaking, there is no limit on transfer budget in the summer. We can target whoever we want." Like us on Facebook
